intro: Terminalia molii, commonly known as African snowball, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of white, fluffy flowers that appear at the ends of branches, giving it its common name. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually oval or elliptic in shape. It produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Terminalia molii is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
